body:
/kind bug

**What happened**:
From `https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e_node/conformance/run_test.sh`
conformance/run_test.sh doest not find kubeconfig file

**What you expected to happen**:
To find kubeconfig file

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
`run_test.sh` from conformance file

**Anything else we need to know?**:

Line 185 : Starting kubelet with args `${KUBELET_KUBECONFIG_DIR}/kubelet.kubeconfig"`
But `KUBELET_KUBECONFIG_DIR` does not exist.
Using `KUBELET_KUBECONFIG=${KUBELET_KUBECONFIG:-"/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig"` from line 80 seems to work properly

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):

> Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.1", GitCommit:"d4ab47518836c750f9949b9e0d387f20fb92260b", GitTreeState:"archive", BuildDate:"2018-04-26T09:29:05Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
> Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.1", GitCommit:"d4ab47518836c750f9949b9e0d387f20fb92260b", GitTreeState:"archive", BuildDate:"2018-04-26T09:29:05Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: hardware configuration
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Fedora 28 Server
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux 4.17.12-200.fc28.x86_64

title: Referencing non existing var in conformance/run_test.sh
